title: 21.Y.O. Man In Custody Over Saturday’s Terrifying Alleged Sexual Assault In Thornbury
text:
CONTENT WARNING: The following article discusses sexual assault and sexual violence.

A 21-year-old man of no fixed address has handed himself into police in Melbourne in connection with investigations into a terrifying sexual assault that occurred in a park in the suburb of Thornbury on Saturday night.

Police confirmed the as-yet unidentified man presented to authorities at Preston Police Station at around 11am this morning, and is currently assisting investigators with their inquiries.

An unnamed 32-year-old woman was said to be walking a friend’s dog through Mayer Park in Thornbury at around 10:30pm on Saturday night when a man approached her, claiming to have lost something. When she went to help, the man allegedly pulled a knife and sexually assaulted her. The woman is said to have then fought back, later telling police she grabbed the knife and that she believed she “made contact” with the attacker, who then fled the scene. Police investigating the incident discovered blood at the site of the attack, leading them to believe he had been injured – possibly stabbed by his own knife – during the scuffle.

The woman was transported to hospital and kept overnight for observation before being discharged on Sunday morning.

Detective acting Inspector Janet Mtichell stated that she believed the accused attacker was “on a mission and he saw the woman coming and he pursued her,” and that when he saw she was “trying to get away,” he then “tried to divert her attention appealing to her good nature.”

Police and SES volunteers worked throughout the night and into Sunday combing the scene for evidence, before an Identikit image of a suspect was released to the public yesterday, leading to a man handing himself into police this morning.

No charges have been laid at this time, and the investigation remains ongoing.
description: A 21-year-old man of no fixed address has handed himself in to police in connection with Saturday's terrfiying alleged sexual assault in Thornbury.
